articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Kate Holton
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will try to revive hope for peace in Ukraine at a meeting with Volodymyr Zelenskiy and other Western leaders on Sunday, two days after the Ukrainian leader and U.S. President Donald Trump clashed in Washington.
articles.title: UK's Starmer tries to revive hope for Ukraine peace at summit

articles.author: Emily Rose, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Jaidaa Ahmad
articles.description: Israel said it will adopt the proposal for Ramadan and Passover.
articles.title: Israel blocks aid into Gaza as ceasefire standoff escalates

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Trump has suggested making Canada the 51st U.S. state.
articles.title: Canada PM Trudeau says protecting independence is his priority in talks with King Charles

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill, Kate Holton
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Sunday dismissed calls to cancel the offer of a state visit to U.S. President Donald Trump after his extraordinary row with Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelenskiy at the White House.
articles.title: UK PM Starmer dismisses calls for Trump's state visit to be cancelled

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday he believed he could salvage his relationship with U.S. President Donald Trump after their explosive meeting in the Oval Office, but that talks needed to continue behind closed doors.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy says he can salvage relationship with US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas will not agree to extend the first phase of the Gaza ceasefire deal as requested by Israel, a senior Hamas official said Sunday.
articles.title: Hamas rejects extending first phase of Gaza ceasefire, ties hostage release to phased deal

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: The acting leader of the breakaway Georgian region of Abkhazia won a presidential election in the territory, months after his predecessor was driven from office, state media said on Sunday, citing preliminary results.
articles.title: Breakaway Abkhazia's acting leader wins presidential election, state media says

articles.author: Andreas Rinke
articles.description: The parties in talks to form Germany's new government are considering quickly setting up two special funds potentially worth hundreds of billions of euros, one for defence and a second for infrastructure, three people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Germany weighs special funds for defence and infrastructure, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Polish cybersecurity services have detected unauthorized access to the Polish Space Agency's (POLSA) IT infrastructure, Minister for Digitalisation Krzysztof Gawkowski said on Sunday.
articles.title: Cyberattack detected at Polish space agency, minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian drone struck a multi-storey apartment building late on Sunday in Ukraine's second largest city, Kharkiv, triggering a fire and injuring eight people, the city's mayor said.
articles.title: Drone hits apartment building in Ukraine's Kharkiv, injures seven, mayor says
